title: Isolating the Absolute Value
text: First, isolate the absolute value by adding $$4$$ to both sides of the equation.
speech: First, isolate the absolute value by adding  4  to both sides of the equation.
pacedSpeech: First, isolate the absolute value by adding   4
to both sides of the equation.

title: Writing Two Equations
text: Then, rewrite the absolute value equation into two equations, $$3x-5=10$$ and $$3x-5=-10$$.
speech: Then, rewrite the absolute value equation into two equations,  3 x minus 5, is equal to, 10  and  3 x, minus 5 is equal to negative 10 .
pacedSpeech: Then, rewrite the absolute value equation into two equations,   3 x minus 5, is equal to, 10
and   3 x, minus 5 is equal to negative 10

title: Solving Equation One
speech: 3 x minus 5, is equal to 10 ,  x, is equal to ?

title: Solving Equation Two
speech: 3 x minus 5, is equal to, negative 10 ,  x, is equal to ?
pacedSpeech: 3 x minus 5, is equal to, negative 10

title: Final Answer
text: The answers to the first and second equations are the answer to the original absolute value equation.
speech: The answers to the first and second equations are the answer to the original absolute value equation.
pacedSpeech: The answers to the first and second equations are the answer to the original absolute value equation.
